results.title: Sensual desire
results.description: A mental quality of desiring sensory gratification. It pulls the mind’s attention toward sights, sounds, smells, tastes, or touches in a search for satisfaction.

results.title: Self Making
results.description: Spiritual or worldly striving to “be someone,” the “I must become something” energy
synonyms: romanticizing some better self or future state

results.title: Self Erasure
results.description: A craving to end suffering through erasure of current experience or identity, e.g. “This self is unbearable; I want out.”

results.title: Non Identification
results.description: A quality of mind that does not construct or fabricate a sense of self in relation to experience. It is the absence of the 'I am this' identification—neither claiming ownership nor defining oneself th
synonyms: lit. not made of that state

results.title: Duccarita sutta - Misconduct
results.description: The Buddha describes the three kinds of misconduct - by body, speech and mind.
results.contentSnippet: The Blessed One spoke on this matter. In this regard, it <mark class="bg-yellow-100 dark:bg-yellow-900 px-1 rounded">is</mark> said:

results.title: Having many desires
results.description: An excessive wanting for possessions, pleasure, or recognition that keeps the mind unsatisfied. It grows from craving and discontentment and feeds restlessness. The many-desiring mind cannot find ease

results.title: Quenching
results.description: An experiential state of being “cooled,” where the burning fever of craving has subsided and the mind dwells in a peace free from the anxiety of needing to become something else.

results.title: Recognition of unsatisfactoriness
results.description: Perceiving the inherent inadequacy and unreliability of conditioned existence. This recognition loosens craving and the pursuit of lasting satisfaction in what cannot endure.

results.title: Macchabandha sutta - Fisherman
results.description: On observing a fisherman killing fish and selling them, the Buddha explains the consequences of cruelty.

results.title: Lack of discernment
results.description: Failure to understand cause and effect or to recognize wholesome from unwholesome. It clouds judgment and makes the mind easily led by craving and aversion.

results.title: Right intention
results.description: Intention of renunciation, goodwill, or harmlessness; the resolve to let go of craving, ill will, and cruelty, cultivating thoughts that lead to peace and liberation.

results.title: Non Restraint
results.description: Failure to guard the sense doors. It occurs when attention chases after the signs and features of sense objects, allowing craving and aversion to invade the mind.
synonyms: grasping at prominent features or details of sense objects
